results.name: Decimal expansion of (3 + sqrt(21))/2.
comment: Decimal expansion of the solution to n/x = x-n for n-3. n/x = x-n with n=1 gives the Golden Ratio = 1.6180339887...

x=3.7912878474... is the shape of a rectangle whose geometric partition (as at A188635) consists of 3 squares, then 1 square, then 3 squares, etc., matching the continued fraction of x, which is [3,1,3,1,3,1,3,1,3,1,...]. (See the Mathematica program below.) - _Clark Kimberling_, May 05 2011

x appears to be the limit for n to infinity of the ratio of the number of even numbers that take n steps to reach 1 to the number of odd numbers that take n steps to reach 1 in the Collatz iteration. As A005186(n-1) is the number of even numbers that take n steps to reach 1, this means x = lim A005186(n-1)/A176866(n). - _Markus Sigg_, Oct 20 2020
